credit_line: Museum purchase from General Acquisitions Endowment Fund and through gift of Mrs. Edward Stern
dimensions: 18 x 18cm (7 1/16 x 7 1/16in.) fringed on all sides
title: Flora's Retinue: Pink
medium:
Medium: linen warp, silk weft
Technique: 4&1 satin damask
description: Small square doily, fringed on all sides, with an ivory linen warp and a bright pink silk weft. A figure of a woman dressed as a pink and sitting on the stem of a large pink, with the word PINK in the upper left corner, all appearing in ivory on a pink ground. A set of six, the doilies would have been used on the table as part of a dessert service.
name: Doily
